00301 // Manifest constants:

00303 static const char PathSep = '/';
00304 
00305 // Helper classes (visitor functions for the list of 
00306 // bindings
00307 
00308 class CInitBinding {
00309   CTCLInterpreter& m_rInterp;
00310 public:
00311   CInitBinding(CTCLInterpreter& rInterp) : m_rInterp(rInterp) {}
00312   void operator()(CTypeFreeBinding* pBinding) {
00313     pBinding->InitBindings(m_rInterp);
00314   }
00315 };
00316 
00317 class CCommit {
00318   CTCLInterpreter& m_rInterp;
00319 public:
00320   CCommit(CTCLInterpreter& rInterp) : m_rInterp(rInterp) {}
00321   void operator()(CTypeFreeBinding* pBinding) {
00322     pBinding->Commit(m_rInterp);
00323   }
00324 };
00325 
00326 class CShutdownBinding {
00327   CTCLInterpreter& m_rInterp;
00328 public:
00329   CShutdownBinding(CTCLInterpreter& rInterp) : m_rInterp(rInterp) {}
00330   void operator()(CTypeFreeBinding* pBinding) {
00331     pBinding->ShutdownBindings(m_rInterp);
00332   }
00333 };
00334 
00335 class CDumpBinding {
00336   int m_fd;
00337 public:
00338   CDumpBinding(int fd) : m_fd(fd) {}
00339   void operator()(CTypeFreeBinding* pBinding) {
00340     pBinding->Dump(m_fd);
00341   }
00342 };
00343 // Implementation file for CConfigurationManager - see the
00344 // header file CConfigurationManager.h for class level documentation.
00345 
00363 void
00364 CConfigurationManager::ReadConfigFile(const char* pName)
00365 {
00366   int fd = open(pName, O_RDONLY);
00367   if(fd < 0) {
00368     throw CErrnoException("ConfigurationManager::ReadConfigFile opening file");
00369   }
00370   try {
00371     ReadConfigFile(fd);
00372     close(fd);
00373   } 
00374   catch(...) {                  // Errors require that I close file and rethrow
00375     close(fd);
00376     throw;
00377   }
00378 }
00386 void 
00387 CConfigurationManager::ReadConfigFile(const string& rName)
00388 {
00389   ReadConfigFile(rName.c_str());
00390 }
00398 void
00399 CConfigurationManager::ReadConfigFile(int fd)
00400 {
00401   //  Create a new intermpreter...
00402 
00403   CTCLInterpreter Interp;
00404 
00405   //   Read in the file.
00406 
00407   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CInitBinding(Interp));
00408 
00409   try {
00410     InternalReadConfigFile(Interp, fd);
00411   }
00412   catch (...) {
00413     for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CCommit(Interp));
00414     for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CShutdownBinding(Interp));
00415     throw;
00416   }
00417 
00418   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CCommit(Interp));
00419   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CShutdownBinding(Interp));
00420 
00421 }
00422 
00433 void
00434 CConfigurationManager::Read1stConfigFile(const vector<string>& rNames)
00435 {
00436   vector<string>::const_iterator i = rNames.begin();
00437   while(i != rNames.end()) {
00438     int fd = open(i->c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00439     if(fd >= 0) {
00440       try {
00441         ReadConfigFile(fd);
00442         close(fd);
00443       }
00444       catch (...) {
00445         close(fd);
00446         throw;
00447       }
00448       break;
00449     }
00450     i++;
00451   }
00452 }
00464 void
00465 CConfigurationManager::Read1stConfigFile(const vector<string>& Paths, 
00466                                          const char* pName)
00467 {
00468   vector<string> FullFilenames;
00469   vector<string>::const_iterator i = Paths.begin();
00470   
00471   while(i != Paths.end()) {
00472     string filename(*i);
00473     filename += PathSep;
00474     filename += pName;
00475     FullFilenames.push_back(filename);
00476 
00477     i++;
00478   }
00479   Read1stConfigFile(FullFilenames);
00480 }
00489 void
00490 CConfigurationManager::Read1stConfigFile(const vector<string>& Paths,
00491                                          const string& rName)
00492 {
00493   Read1stConfigFile(Paths, rName.c_str());
00494 }
00495 
00510 void
00511 CConfigurationManager::ReadAllConfigFiles(const vector<string>& Names)
00512 {
00513   CTCLInterpreter Interp;
00514   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CInitBinding(Interp));
00515 
00516   vector<string>::const_iterator i = Names.begin();
00517   while(i != Names.end()) {
00518     int fd = open(i->c_str(), O_RDONLY);
00519     if(fd >= 0) {
00520       try {
00521         InternalReadConfigFile(Interp, fd);
00522       }
00523       catch(...) {              // Faile config file execution results in 
00524         close(fd);              // file closure...
00525         for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), // finalization of
00526                    CCommit(Interp));                     // the config phase 
00527         for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), 
00528                    CShutdownBinding(Interp));   
00529         throw;                  // and re-throw of the exception.
00530       }
00531       close (fd);
00532     }
00533     i++;
00534   }
00535 
00536   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CCommit(Interp));
00537   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CShutdownBinding(Interp));
00538 }
00549 void
00550 CConfigurationManager::ReadAllConfigFiles(const vector<string>& rPaths,
00551                                           const string&         rFilename)
00552 {
00553   vector<string> FullFilenames;
00554   vector<string>::const_iterator i = rPaths.begin();
00555   
00556   while(i != rPaths.end()) {
00557     string Filename(*i);
00558     Filename += PathSep;
00559     Filename += rFilename;
00560     FullFilenames.push_back(Filename);
00561 
00562     i++;                        // 
00563   }
00564   ReadAllConfigFiles(FullFilenames);
00565 }
00578 void
00579 CConfigurationManager::ReadAllConfigFiles(const vector<string>& rPaths,
00580                                            const char*           pFilename)
00581 {
00582   string Filename(pFilename);
00583   ReadAllConfigFiles(rPaths, Filename);
00584 }
00600 void
00601 CConfigurationManager::WriteConfigFile(int fd)
00602 {
00603   //
00604   // Construct and write the header.
00605   //
00606   string header("# Configuration file written by NSCL program");
00607   header  += " configuration subsystem\n";
00608 
00609   time_t EpochElapsedTime;
00610   time(&EpochElapsedTime);
00611   header += "#   Written on: ";
00612   header += ctime(&EpochElapsedTime); // ctime gives a \n too.
00613 
00614   header += "# Written by: ";
00615   char* pUsername = getlogin();
00616   if(pUsername) {
00617     header += pUsername;
00618   }
00619   else {
00620     header += ">>> Unknown <<<";
00621   }
00622   header += '\n';
00623   
00624   int nbytes = write(fd, header.c_str(), header.length());
00625   if(nbytes < 0) 
00626     throw CErrnoException("CConfigurationManager::WriteConfigFile.. header");
00627 
00628   // Visit each binding and dump it.
00629 
00630   for_each(m_lBindings.begin(), m_lBindings.end(), CDumpBinding(fd));
00631 }
00640 void
00641 CConfigurationManager::WriteConfigFile(const char* pName)
00642 {
00643   int fd = creat(pName, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IRGRP);
00644   if(fd < 0) 
00645     throw CErrnoException("CConfigurationManager::WriteConfigFile.. Opening");
00646 
00647   WriteConfigFile(fd);
00648 }
00656 void
00657 CConfigurationManager::WriteConfigFile(const string& rName)
00658 {
00659   WriteConfigFile(rName.c_str());
00660 }
00677 void
00678 CConfigurationManager::InternalReadConfigFile(CTCLInterpreter& rInterp,
00679                                               int              fd)
00680 {
00681   // Figure out the size of the file...
00682 
00683   struct stat FileInfo;
00684   if(fstat(fd, &FileInfo) < 0) {
00685     throw 
00686      CErrnoException("CConfigurationManager::InternalReadConfigFile fstat(2)");
00687   }
00688 
00689   // Allocate data for the file and read it in:
00690 
00691   char* pBuffer = new char[FileInfo.st_size + 1];
00692   
00693   int nbytes = read(fd, pBuffer, FileInfo.st_size);
00694   if(nbytes < 0) {
00695     delete []pBuffer;
00696     throw
00697       CErrnoException("CConfigurationManager::InternalReadConfigFile read(2)");
00698   }
00699   pBuffer[FileInfo.st_size] = '\0'; // Null terminate the script.
00700 
00701   // interpret the file...
00702  
00703   try {                         // Need to clean up pBuffer on exception.
00704     rInterp.GlobalEval(pBuffer);
00705   }
00706   catch (...) {
00707     delete []pBuffer;
00708     throw;
00709   }
00710   
00711 }
Generated on Wed Feb 5 13:39:37 2003 for Spectrodaq External Event Framework by 1.2.15
